intro: Comesperma calymega var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf comesperma, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or cream-colored flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. The species is noted for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
